Package grid4p

Class Gknob

  • java.lang.Object
    • grid4p.Gknob
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mknob
    public class Gknob
extends java.lang.Object
    A Gknob (GRID Knob) is a representation of a modifiable physical GRID parameter. A static Gknob array is handled by the Grid class, and as such, Gknob-s needn't be explicitly declared or defined by the user. That being said, it is welcome and encouraged for the user to explicitly use Gknob objects, as it makes the program more readable.
    See Also:
    Grid

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void free()
      Sets the used flag to false, indicating this Gknob as vacant for configuration
      float get()
      Returns the held value, which is the raw integer value mapped to the range specified by min and max
      boolean getB()
      Returns the boolean button value indicating whether or not the Gknob's button is pushed down.
      int getRaw()
      Returns the unmapped value held by the Gknob.
      float max()
      Returns the maximum value that the Gknob can hold.
      float min()
      Returns the minimum value that the Gknob can hold.
      float value()
      Returns the held value, which is the raw integer value mapped to the range specified by min and max This is alias of get()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • min

        public float min()
        Returns the minimum value that the Gknob can hold. This normally does not change during runtime and is primarily for reference and sketch-wide consistency.
        Returns:
        the Gknob's maximum value

        Returns:
